security_audit.summary: The code only performs HTTPS requests to the official KEGG REST endpoint (https://rest.kegg.jp) and returns response text. No sensitive file access, environment harvesting, or execution primitives were found. All network operations are legitimate API calls to a well-known bioinformatics database.

content.user_title: Query KEGG pathways with direct REST access
content.value_statement: You need reliable KEGG pathway and gene data for research workflows. This skill provides direct REST calls and helper functions for fast retrieval and mapping.
actual_capabilities: List entries by database or organism with /list
Search genes or compounds with /find options
Retrieve entries and formats like FASTA, MOL, KGML, JSON, or image
Convert identifiers between KEGG and external databases
limitations: KEGG API access is for academic users only
Requests are limited to 10 entries per call and 1 entry for image, KGML, or JSON
Functions return raw text without parsing or validation
No built in retries or caching are provided

use_cases.title: Pathway mapping report
use_cases.description: Map a gene list to KEGG pathways and retrieve pathway details for a summary report.

use_cases.title: Drug interaction check
use_cases.description: Check KEGG drug interaction entries for a small drug set before analysis.

use_cases.title: Cross database ID map
use_cases.description: Convert KEGG gene IDs to NCBI or UniProt IDs for dataset joins.

prompt_templates.title: List human pathways
prompt_templates.prompt: List KEGG human pathways and return the first 10 pathway IDs and names.

prompt_templates.title: Find gene and pathways
prompt_templates.prompt: Find the KEGG gene ID for TP53 and list the linked pathways.

prompt_templates.title: Convert IDs for integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert all human KEGG genes to UniProt IDs and explain the output format.

prompt_templates.title: Retrieve pathway data
prompt_templates.prompt: Get the KEGG glycolysis pathway for human in KGML and summarize the key fields to parse.

output_examples.input: Find KEGG pathways linked to the human TP53 gene.
output: Linked pathways include: p53 signaling, pathways in cancer, apoptosis
Use kegg_get on each pathway ID for details

best_practices: Batch entry IDs with plus signs and stay within the 10 entry limit
Use organism specific codes for faster and clearer results
Check HTTP errors in responses before parsing
anti_patterns: Running large rapid request loops without pauses
Requesting image, KGML, or JSON for multiple entries at once
Using this skill for commercial KEGG access

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it provides Python functions and REST guidance that work across Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the main usage limits?
faq.answer: KEGG limits to 10 entries per request and 1 entry for image, KGML, or JSON outputs.

faq.question: Can it integrate with other bioinformatics tools?
faq.answer: Yes, you can combine outputs with Biopython or R KEGGREST for larger workflows.

faq.question: Does it access my local files or secrets?
faq.answer: No, it only makes HTTPS requests to the official KEGG REST endpoint.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot empty results?
faq.answer: Verify organism codes, entry IDs, and query syntax, and retry with broader keywords.

faq.question: How does it compare to bioservices?
faq.answer: This skill provides direct KEGG REST control, while bioservices offers a broader multi database wrapper.
